intro: Anemone petiolulosa, commonly known as the clustered anemone, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from March to May. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a soft, hairy texture. Its stems are usually short and clustered, giving it a compact, bushy appearance. Anemone petiolulosa thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
